attributes.action: Ask this Government to consider issuing a medal to all serving armed forces.
attributes.background: I consider anyone serving their country for security and safety reasons should be acknowledged by means of a medal of service for their dedication and support to make this a safer and better World for us all to live and work in as a show of appreciation.

attributes.action: start a national lottery to run health service
attributes.background: save our health service

attributes.action: Make smoking any substance/cigarette illegal in the UK.
attributes.background: This is a very strong point I feel needs to be raised as the damage caused to bodies and minds from smoking is dangerous and worrying. It rips away at your organs and also influences children and young adults to smoke as they will begin to think it is an okay and unharmful thing to do.

attributes.action: Introduce a Mandatory 10 year prison sentence for Vehicle theft/ involvement in.
attributes.background: The people of Great Britain are sick of working hard to buy vehicles, only to have them stolen by criminals who do not care. The impact of their crimes affect thousands of people, who suffer untold hardship, financial loss & emotional distress due to crime. The law needs to be a major deterrent.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently the penalty for stealing a vehicle does not fit the crime, many criminals walk free from court with punitive punishments, despite causing huge problems for the victims of their crime.

The law needs to ensure that theft of a vehicle is so harshly punished it will make it unappealing.

attributes.action: Government to reform the honours system to include posthumous awards
attributes.background: I'm creating this petition to call upon the Government to reform the honours system, so that knighthoods can be awarded posthumously. Its a shame that people that have contributed something for the country but are sadly no longer with us cannot be recognised for their achievements.
attributes.additional_details: A prime example is Bobby Moore. Its now the 50th anniversary of the year of England winning the world cup. He was a leader, a gentleman and credit to this country. Geoff Hurst has been knighted so surely Bobby Moore should be too (posthumously) as he was the Captain of the team, especially in this anniversary year. It would be a very fitting way to celebrate the achievement of the the man and the team.

attributes.action: Create more opportunities to further vocational subject skills in state schools.
attributes.background: In state education here in the U.K our youth have next to no chances to properly further their vocational skills, e.g dance! Many schools not offering a thing in some of these areas that could potentially be the child's gift in life! For many school is the only outlet for them to progress in this.
attributes.additional_details: Focus on sporting and academic departments take away sometimes completely from the vocational or artistic side. If that is a career a youth would want to pursue then it is the EDUCATION systems duty to EDUCATE the students on such matters! But no input or teaching on these skills are taught, hindering the abilities of our youths and holding them back from their potential, MANY, MANY people have a skill in vocational activities and subjects that could lead to a career in it.

attributes.action: Automate all trains so there are no longer drivers or manual door openers.
attributes.background: It is ludicrous in 2016 that huge swathes of the country should be held to ransom by union action over something as silly as who controls the doors - personnel are paid far too much to press a button and move a lever. The technology has existed since the 70s to automate all of this.
attributes.additional_details: In 2016 Train Drivers hold the country to ransom whenever they want a pay bump, or even more favourable conditions. The average transport for London driver earns £55k, in the south, the average is £39k. No part of their job requires a human. It's time for progress, guarantee these people jobs until retirement, hire no new drivers - and slowly automate away the skill gap so that the current drivers don't suffer, but that no drivers can come along to make the rest of the country suffer.

attributes.action: Bring university fees down to £4.5 grand a year
attributes.background: People either can't or never pay the money if the government wants their money back they need to bring the fees down

attributes.action: To start the Tax Office and Government standard tax year from the 1st January.
attributes.background: The start date for the Fiscal Year of the 6th April was fixed when the UK moved to the Gregorian Calendar and is based on the antiquated "Quarter Days". Computers and Spreadsheets work best with whole months and years.  It is time that the Government Fiscal year is brought into the 21st century.

attributes.action: Solution to restrict migration, whilst appeasing freedom of movement
attributes.background: All solutions on this issue will not please everyone, so neutral ground must be found. This I believe is a good solution to restrict the number of incoming EU nationals while maintaining freedom of movement to those who genuinely want to live & work in the UK, which in turn allows free trade with EU
attributes.additional_details:
•	All EU arrivals to the UK must complete 24 months of paid contributions to the state before receiving free NHS care 
•	Prior to completing the 24 months, all those who do not qualify for free state medical care must have a private European style health insurance policy
•	All foreign nationals wishing to transfer money overseas must pay a government stamp duty or tax
•	EU nationals claiming benefits, a maximum of 20% of income into the account is allowed to be transferred outside of the UK

attributes.action: Make politics more inclusive for people with disabilities.
attributes.background:
I want to make politics and  careers  in local and central government more easier and accessible for people with disabilities and learning difficulties.
I would like to see more people with disabilities involved in policy making and government positions.

attributes.action: Make prisons rehabilitation centres to lower crime caused by released inmates.
attributes.background:
People who are put into prison are being released and causeing eaither the same crime or a worse one. 
Other countries have resorted to this tactic of instead of keeping inmates locked in like animals they give the a working environment where they can become better working citizens.

attributes.action: All petrol/diesel pumps must display taxes taken per litre and per gallon.
attributes.background: Most people aren't aware that the vast majority of the cost of fuel doesn't go to the oil companies who have to drill to find the stuff, transport it around the world, refine it, and deliver it to your local garage, but to the state that has done none of this.
attributes.additional_details: The sum of taxes should include VAT and the taxation of the oil companies and the garages or stores who provide the pumps.

attributes.action: Reduce university fees from £9000 a year to £1500 a year.
attributes.background: With fees being so high and possibly continuing to rise, the amount of students who are unable to afford further education is increasing, and any student who continues with further education will leave with at least £30,000 worth of debt, which they have to pay back with interest, which is unfair.
attributes.additional_details: Students have to pay university fees and living fees for the entirety of their stay at university which can range from three to seven years, possibly more. It is almost financially impossible for the average household to support this, even worse for lower income households. With the amount of students who attend university increasing (2015 recorded 532,300 students) paying £2000 each, per year should be more than enough to support universities, whilst being financially possible for students.

attributes.action: Make all pest problems the landlord or home owners responsibility
attributes.background: landlords and home owners should be legally responsible for all pest problems within the building and not just ones that transmit diseases.

attributes.action: Offer discounted counselling to housing professionals.
attributes.background: The world of social housing is changing drastically. Everyday, housing professionals are presented with greater challenges due to welfare reform. While we are told to advocate greater mental health awareness, little or nothing is being done to protect those who work with most vulnerable in society.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to the implementation of reforms such as the benefit cap and universal credit, the already emotionally draining work of housing professionals is becoming more demanding daily. We must now delve deeper into the lives of our customers and often discover horrific issues such as domestic abuse, child sexual exploitation and even dead bodies in our properties.
To help our customers through these issues we must become heavily involved and yet many are not receiving the emotional support necessary.

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal Lagoon Power instead of Nuclear - they are green & reliable!
attributes.background: Tidal power is totally reliable and always available. It does not rely on ANY fuel, the wind, or the sun. There is NO waste, it is totally green and works 24/7/365. The tide timing is different in different places, so there are no big gaps. If designed properly, they could be virtually invisible.
attributes.additional_details: Britain has a big coastline, and the proposed tidal lagoon in Wales could be the ideal starting point and testing ground, though I personally think the artist's impression is awful and I think the whole thing should be hidden away out of sight, which it could be if designed properly, a bit like the Cruachan hydroelectric generating station in the mountains in Scotland.

attributes.action: Change legislation for VED to weekly. DVLA gain 3 X payments every change.
attributes.background: Amend legislation from monthly vehicle tax to weekly. If a new car is bought privately that car will be taxed, and so will the buyers,neither transferable,but the purchased car will need re-taxed, in effect the DVLA are claiming three ( 3 ) times the duty on each car sold under these conditions.
attributes.additional_details: Currently if a car is legally taxed and driven on a road when it is written off or changed, the tax is cancelled, but duty paid for that month,a new car bought privately will be taxed also, but not transferable under current legislation.In effect the DVLA are penalizing motorists by raking in three ( 3 ) times the duty on each car sold under these conditions.Charging VEL on a weekly basis would be fairer, and as most transactions are made through the DVLA website it should be easy to change.

attributes.action: Change the Student Loan to allow Student Exchange Programs
attributes.background: The Government should allow the student loan scheme to include loans for Student/Foreign Exchange Programs for those wanting to go beyond the European grant of study grant which maybe abolished after Brexit which means the Government must inclue a scheme/loan for Student/Foreign Exchange Program.

attributes.action: Stop banks charging,for IN THE RED on pensioners & those on low incomes,
attributes.background: Fed up on this action, continually in the red simply because of these £32 deductions!
attributes.additional_details: Now we are enforced to get paid by the Banks, this did not happen when we were paid by the Post Office, with our Pension Books

attributes.action: The government should raise the funding for music education in primary schools.
attributes.background: This government has cut funding for musical education in primary schools. The funding should be increased back to what it was in 2010 before the conservatives came to government. Despite Nicky Morgan's claims, music is a necessary part of education, and should be something no child should lack.
attributes.additional_details: To make a film better, we add music. To improve a dining experience, we add music. To make shopping experiences better, we add music. To make schools better, we take away music. This is wrong and should be undone. The government cut funding for a vital part of education for primary school children. These children now no longer learn anything in school about music: something every child should understand, at least on a simple level. The funding should be increased.

attributes.action: Invest more in our National Security to avoid an attack in the UK
attributes.background: Europe is getting unsecured. There has been terror attacks in the most important countries like France, Belgium and Germany. The United Kingdom may be affected in the future as well. We more security, especially on train staions, crowded places, Tourist attractions and big cities.

attributes.action: Change the law, to give people in rural village communities the right to buy.
attributes.background: I’m living in a housing association home in a village I grew up in.The Housing (Right to Acquire or Enfranchise)(Designated Rural Areas in the Southwest) Order 1997  stops selling of right to buy properties in villages/towns with populations of less than 3000 residents it is unfair  on rural tenants
attributes.additional_details: My application to have the right to aquire/buy in January 2016 was rejected. I’ve written to and been ignored by my local MP for support and received an unsatisfactory reply from Brandon Lewis, Housing Minister at the time (Even though he agrees to the sale of housing association homes). My only recourse is this petition to get the issue raised in parliament and hopefully remove the 3000 resident  stipulation as the housing and planning bill including, right to buy is currently being considered

attributes.action: Enable transfer of pension funds to lifetime ISA for use as a mortgage deposit
attributes.background: I struck upon an idea where you could possibly transfer a stakeholder pension into the new lifetime ISA coming soon.  The idea would be to only allow for security against a mortgage.
attributes.additional_details: I would suggest that the transferred fund would be exempt from the annual government bonus but attract normal interest.

attributes.action: Review British army prior Laser Eye surgery policy
attributes.background: Currently you cant have laser eye before joining the British army prior eyesight doesn't meet the minimum standards. As laser eye surgery makes you eyesight better why should the minimum standards before the surgery stop you. Why stop people getting Laser Eye surgery so there can serve their country
attributes.additional_details: "Spectacle or contact lens corrections must not be greater then -6 dioptres or +6 dioptres in any meridian." - Army Jobs "Laser Eye surgery or anything alike would not enable you to join as your prior eyesight doesn't meet the minimum standards." - Army Jobs.

attributes.action: Allow ALL tax payers to vote.
attributes.background: People who have no job and are claiming benefits but have been born in the UK are allowed to vote. People who were born elsewhere and moved here and are paying taxes and making a valuable contribution to the country they live in do NOT have the right to vote in the UK.

attributes.action: Relax immigration rules for elderly/disabled parents of British Citizens
attributes.background: my parents are in india. my father has been heart patient & had stroke last week and consequently become paralysis. my mother has been getting treatment of broken hips and can't look after my father.
attributes.additional_details: my parents are in india. my father has been heart patient & had stroke last week and consequently become paralysis. my mother has been getting treatment of broken hips and can't look after my father. I am married with 2 school attendee children in UK hence very stressful & difficult situation for me to go back India to look after my parents. Please allow me to bring my parents here in UK.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's from the outside lane.
attributes.background: Heavy goods vehicles in the outside lane are a danger to other road users as well as causing huge backlogs of traffic while they attempt overtaking moves at little more than the speed of the vehicle in the inside lane.Cars only in the outside lane please
attributes.additional_details: Last week when leaving Felixstowe docks on the A14 I followed a heavy goods vehicle for 15 miles in the outside lane while they attempted to overtake another HGV which was in the inside lane. A huge queue of cars had built up behind me as the trucks rolled on side by side at virtually identical speed. Very frustrating for other motorists and also dangerous. These heavy vehicles with restricted speed limit should stay in the inside lane at all times

attributes.action: Establish an electoral system that requires an MP to receive 50% +1 of  turnout.
attributes.background: The UK electorate like to have an individual to vote for and be accountable. The current system allows an MP to take up a seat when the majority of constituents vote against them. Rendering them unaccountable.

attributes.action: Make It Complusory For Every Biker To Have A Helmet Cam!
attributes.background: Loosing somebody that is close to you is never easy. Epecially when it may seem like you don't have any closure to what happened to them. I think that it ALL bikers should wear helmet cams so should the worst happen to them the family can be justified and it could also make the inquest easier.

attributes.action: A call for direct use of the military in Libya
attributes.background: The civil war in Libya is awful and needs to be stopped as it is allowing jihadist groups to gain control over the North of Africa, i believe we should but an end to this war with direct force

attributes.action: Amend the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2011 to allow for early General Elections
attributes.background: The Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2011 should be changed to legislate for the triggering of a General Election when a change in leadership of the majority party results in the resignation of the Prime Minister whilst there is more than 20% of the defined 5 year parliamentary fixed term left to run.
attributes.additional_details: Often a change in leadership of a majority political party leads to a change of Prime Minister and a reshuffle of senior Cabinet posts. This can lead to changes in the political agenda of the Government that take it away from the platform on which it was elected. If the period between the date of appointment of a new Prime Minister and the date on which Parliament would be dissolved under the Fixed-Term Parliaments Act 2011 is more than a year, an early General Election should be triggered.

attributes.action: Only allow the UK to go to war after allowing the citizens to vote Yes or No.
attributes.background: The decision to go to war should not rest in the hands of the politicians. We voted them in to act in our best interests but it is obvious this is not the case. Going to war costs a massive amount of money, time and lives. We should protect our country from invasion. Not invade others.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot Inquiry

attributes.action: to make telling jokes about child abuse illegal
attributes.background: i feel that people will tell child abuse jokes and think its funny and fine i strongly disagree with this going back decades,, protesting on building sites etc,,, before social media
attributes.additional_details: a guy was telling a michael jackson joke back in the mid nineties on a building site,, i said sorry mate don't like those kind of jokes,,, not fair on children,, him and i went toe to toe,, i didn't mind it seems many jokes about adults,, are offensive and wrong but jokes so called about children are fine,,, this is totally wrong,, totally

attributes.action: Make Slurry Tanks safer, an  alarm should sound & also inform authorities.
attributes.background: Slurry is a mixture of manure and water. Waste from animals are stored  during the winter when cattle are kept indoors, to be spread during the warmer months. It has to be broken up & mixed, to be spread. At the mixing stage the odourless & invisible gases are produced that can kill within seconds.
attributes.additional_details:
There is no such thing as a safe slurry tank. Gases are produced by bacteria during the decomposition of slurry, these can kill instantly. The gas settles in a cloud over the top of the slurry during mixing. 

It stays in these tanks maybe for a number of months and a lethal combination of gases build up, including methane, carbon dioxide, ammonia, and worst of all, probably, hydrogen sulphide.

attributes.action: Ensure the Health Secretary is a qualified doctor of medicine.
attributes.background: The current health secretary has no medical experience, which is illogical with regards to the responsibility involved in such a job. He is also known to have supported medical practices with no scientific basis. This highlights clear problems with the way in which the health secretary is appointed.

attributes.action: Add Black English to the national census
attributes.background: In England and Wales, non-white ethnic groups, as such, are not offered the standard option of including ‘English’ as part of their ethnic group: they’re officially classified only as ‘Black British’, ‘Asian British’, etc., and not ‘Black English’ or ‘Asian English’.
attributes.additional_details: By contrast, black and Asian persons living in Scotland are permitted to identify as ‘Black Scottish’ and ‘Asian Scottish’.English people" are both a nation and an ethnic group, having white skin is not a requirement.

attributes.action: Make panel van speed limits the same as cars.
attributes.background:
Speed limit for vans on an A road is 50mph - the same as a lorry.
This was set in 1982 when vans did not have disc brakes, ABS, etc.
An increase to 60mph would help with traffic flow and stop dangerous overtaking of vans.

attributes.action: Provide visas for 1st degree relatives of international students for graduation
attributes.background: International students are expected to pay university fees far in excess of their British counterparts and therefore pay much more towards improving and maintaining the universities. Sadly, we often turn our backs on these people by refusing their family visas to attend their graduation.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools to teach all kinds of religion in schools equally
attributes.background: Schools are currently teaching religious studies or religious education to our children which is heavily based on Christianity. If it was compulsory to teach all religions and cultures our kids would have more understanding and be more accepting to people with different beliefs reducing segregation.
attributes.additional_details: Recent political movements have lead to a 52 percent rise in race related reports. I believe this starts at home and in school. If we educate our children in school about every religion we can they will develops educated views and become more tolerant and accepting of others. This is so very important to our multi cultural society and progression as humans that we need to get this movement to change the way we teach.

attributes.action: Give all UK Residents with NI number a vote. No taxation without representation.
attributes.background:
At 16 someone can legally leave school, get a job and pay tax. But they are denied a vote in General Elections on how that tax is spent.

The same is true for hard-working UK residents without UK citizenship. 

To address this iniquity give everyone with a National Insurance number a vote.
attributes.additional_details:
Current eligibility rules for voting in General Election (Electoral Commission)
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/i-am-a/voter/registering-to-vote-and-the-electoral-register

Current eligibility rules for National Insurance number (HMRC)
https://www.gov.uk/apply-national-insurance-number

attributes.action: Stop parties from supplying 'helpful' questions to ask the PM.
attributes.background: The party in power circulates 'helpful' questions to ask the PM during PM's questions. The number of questions allowed to be asked is limited, therefore these 'helpful' questions are being asked instead of Mp's asking important constituency and national matters.
attributes.additional_details:
Inside the Commons 2015 Season 1 Episode 1 shows this point perfectly and the times stated below explains exactly what we need to stop to allow more important issues being brought up during PMQ's.

Yet another reason why the public feel so wary of politicians, they are constantly wasting time and squandering the chance to reply to real topics, purely for self-gratification.

40:33 - 43:55
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bnq2cY299xs

attributes.action: We in uk deserves a tax threshold raise from 11k to 68k whatever the income.
attributes.background: We don't mind paying tax. Just don't tax us before the 68k income limit PA. Sign this people it will help everyone.

attributes.action: Brexit talks by committee of 65, on the basis of proportional representation.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom has now voted to leave the EU, to ensure that the negotiations are carried out with every person from every political background being represented I propose a committee carry out the talks based on a Proportional Representation distribution of seats from the last General election.
attributes.additional_details:
This is the biggest political event in our life times, no one party should be tarred with the negotiations of extracting the United Kingdom from the EU.
All parts of society need to feel 'United' in a common goal and see first hand that their voice is being heard.
The Scottish, Welsh, Irish, Labour, Conservatives, Lib dems, Greens, Ukip all represent the United Kingdom.... Let us Unite for the common good where no one is left behind unheard.

attributes.action: To rule out membership of the E.E.A
attributes.background: Following the vote on the U.K.'s membership of the E.U. there is much discussion about the way forward. One option is membership of the E.E.A. given the express desire of the public, in voting to leave, is to establish sovereignty and control of our boarders this option is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Start a fund to help EU nationals obtain their permanent residence cards
attributes.background: This petition asks that the government considers starting a fund to help all EU nationals that wish to become British citizens pay for their permanent residence cards and associated lawyer’s fees, allowing them to further integrate with the UK before it leaves the EU.
attributes.additional_details: EU nationals that have migrated to the UK have a net positive contribution to the UK economy. These EU nationals now face having to obtain a permanent residence card to remain in the UK or obtain British citizenship, a requirement to vote on decisions affecting their future. Before November 12th 2015 there was no requirement for citizens of EU countries to obtain a permanent residence card. There is no guarantee that EU and EEA citizens will be able to remain without one. http://bit.ly/1RJEOMm

attributes.action:
New Bank Holiday.
The Epiphany should be a national bank holiday.
attributes.background: I always have to work the Epiphany and I feel that this is not correct. Whilst other cultures are allowed extra time off work to celebrate their beliefs, myself and many others are denied this opportunity. If it was a Bank Holiday, everybody could unite, join in and celebrate this event.
attributes.additional_details:
Epiphany is a public holiday in countries such as Austria, Colombia, Croatia, Cyprus, Poland, Ethiopia (but on different date that varies annually), parts of Germany, Greece, Italy, Slovakia, Spain, and Uruguay. 

http://www.timeanddate.com/holidays/common/epiphany

attributes.action: Discuss the establishment of a rival EU 'London based Global trading group'.
attributes.background: The United Kingdom's decision to leave the EU has created an ideal opportunity to create a separate trading group outside of and free of the influences of the EU. Based in London, the new trading group will operate in a new purpose built center, whose sole focus will be economy and trade.
attributes.additional_details: The UK's decision to leave the EU is a fantastic chance to create a truly global trading group. With the UK's strong links to her commonwealth countries(both former and present), the United States, China and Japan, the establishment of a new economic trading group based in London in new, purpose headquarters will undoubtedly attract existing members of the EU who are reluctant to leave. The strengths of the new Pan trading group, is the absence of politics and its location in a truly global city.

attributes.action: In an Indy ref 2, Scottish Regions that vote to remain in the uk should remain.
attributes.background: The SNP government have consistently said that it supports the will of the Scottish people - if that's so then they must support a region by region vote allowing those regions who wish to remain in the uk to do so.
attributes.additional_details: After the eu referendum regional parties jumped on the bandwagon by turning a uk vote in to a countries vote all to further their own agendas. That's fine however if regions within those countries want to remain in the uk they should not be denied their democratic right to do so.

attributes.action: Ban the use of in game purchases for non-permanent downloads
attributes.background: The gaming industry is slowly being ruined by games that are paid, yet have objectives or objectives that are almost inachievable without paying more. We therefore call for legislation to ban these purchases for this virtual cash. By this we do not mean paid permanent addons or expansions.
attributes.additional_details: For example: You buy a game. You spend £40. Then you start playing and you pretty much get forced or pressured to buy 'virtual cash' to get certain things in the game that is free dlc but so overpriced in the games' currency that achievement of this is only possible through either excessive play to near extremes or take the easy route and pay your hard earned cash to 'quick buy' this. Not only is this discrimination to those who have less money but its ruining games and must therefore be banned.
